tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
There will always be signals.They will always need processing.

“There will always be missions. Certain mission are impossible and inevitable. Here is a chance to prove that impossible doesn’t exist.”

A terrorist organisation is going to launch a missile to destroy a city. 

The robot has hacked the launch codes to the missile. Unfortunately, the transmitter in the bot is damaged, forcing it to indicate the code. You can view the code from a satellite view and send the confirmation to the bot. Your bot alone can display the code in order to make sure the codes are received correctly. 

You have one chance to stop the missile launch by hacking into the system and replacing the launch codes, with the replacement codes you are given. With a satellite view of hostile area, to infiltrate the hostile area and cease the launch

tabs.title: Problem Statement
tabs.content:
Design an autonomous bot with image processing which is capable of completing this mission.

EVENT FORMAT:

ROUND 1: CODE OF DECIMATION

» The bot has to trace the given binary code. This should be done by using image processing and not by other sensors. The arena will ocntain 1s and 0s in same colour.

» Pictures of arena’s top view will be provided. The bot has to indicate the given binary code (with the help of LED or BUZZER).

» On successful completion of your first round you will proceed to the second round.

» To differentiate between 1 and 0, any inbuilt character recognition functions should not be used. The code should be built by the participants. 1s and 0s can be in any size.

» For example: If given code is 110, the bot has to move to 1 and indicate it using led or buzzer and after a definite time, indicate the second 1 and then it has to move on to 0 and indicate it.

 

ROUND 2: SALVATION

» Now the bot has to go through the forest area (green circles) avoiding the enemy camps (red circles) and has to reach the enemy’s control room (blue) and blink led three times on abort of missile launch. Remaining area in the arena is inaccessible by the bot.

» The circles can be of any size with diameter within 15 to 30 cm.

 

  For any queries regarding components please contact SP Robotic Works.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
GENERAL RULES:

» Team may consist of a maximum of 4 members.

» The members of the team can be from different colleges/institutions.

» The students should have their institution ID along with their k! ID to be eligible for participation.

» Participants must only use the camera provided in the arena. 

» Any microcontroller can be used. Readymade kits are strictly prohobited.

» The communication can be either wired or wireless. Readymade modules like XBee / Bluetooth bee are allowed. USB to microcontroller cables are allowed for communication. No keys on the laptop can be pressed during the trial.

» Calibration time will be given before the trial.

» Any malpractice will lead to disqualification.

» Damaging the arena will lead to disqualification.

» The event organisers reserve the right to make modifications to any of the rules if deemed necessary and their decision in any situation is final and binding on all.

Bot Specifications:

» The robot should be of 25 cm x 20 cm x10 cm in dimensions which will be checked before the event. Violation of the same will lead to the disqualification of the bot.

» The potential difference between any two points in the bot should not exceed 12V.

» The power supply can be on-board or off-board. In case of an external power supply, ensure that the wire remains slack throughout.

» The camera will be placed over the arena in such a way that it covers the entire arena. Live feed from the camera will be given to the contestant's laptop.

» On board cameras and sensors of any kind are prohibited.

» The robot is allowed to communicate with a computer outside the arena- either wired or wireless. For wired communication, the wire must be slack at all instants of the trial. 

» The team is required to bring their laptop with the necessary software installed.

» Only Image Processing methods are to be used.
